Thanks! However, can I get a confirmation from staff to see if its possible to petition this?

Definitely you can try. Try to contact with major advisor and/or faculty advisor directly.

According to this: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv, no. It must be CS/EE/EECS.

children.subject: I am also wondering about this. Specifically I am interested in IEOR 263A and IEOR 265, both of which are various rigorous courses similar to EE126 and EE127, probably harder since they are graduate level. If an advisor could respond to this that would be great!

history.content:
Hi, 

Next semester will be my last semester as a CS major. I currently still have 8 more units of CS/EE classes left in order to complete the major. However, there are some courses in the School of Information and IEOR department that seem very interesting to me. Two examples are: 

IND ENG 142 - Introduction to Machine Learning and Data Analytics

INFO 159 - Natural Language Processing

However, do to my time left, the requirements, and the commitments I have outside of classes, I can't just simply add in one or both of those classes. Therefore, I was wondering if I can use one and/or both of these courses as a CS class requirement, NOT technical elective (I have already completed my technical elective units). 

Thanks
history.subject: Questions Regarding CS Requirement
